page.title: 17MUSICAL LIFE IN HITCHIN
page.content: Hitchin is a centre for music.{Rural {Music Schools Association,}Little Benslow Hills, founded 1929 by Mary Ibberson, runs instrumental & choral courses;{North Herts Music School, Highbury Rd., head R.Pope, courses for youth; and{North Herts College}Music Dept. (founded 1969 by John Railton), courses for intending entrants to colleges of music. {Hitchin Town Brass Band,}conductor Peter Broadbent, in the Championship Section, dates back to before 1875. {North Herts Guild of Singers,}founded 1968 by John Railton, performs large choral works.{Hitchin Thespians perform musical and choral works. {Hitchin Concert Orchestra}(amateur). Shops: Barenreiter; Hitchin Music Centre; Richard Reason Pianos; and {John Myatt,}the country's leading supplier of woodwind and brass.
